net.hudup.core.logistic

Class MathUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.logistic.MathUtil

  • public final class MathUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This final class provides utility static methods for mathematics such as summing, taking logarithm, powering, formatting, rounding, vector operators, matrix operators, etc.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

    • Method Detail

      • sum

        public static double[] sum(double[][] data,
                           int order)
        Firstly, the method creates the resulted vector A. Secondly, for each row vector of the specified matrix data, the method calculates the sum of values of such row vector. Such each sum is raised to the power of the specified order, which results a raised sum. Finally, such raised sum is put in to the resulted vector A. So the resulted vector A which has many raised sums is returned.
        Parameters:
        data - specified matrix
        order - each sum is raised to the power.
        Returns:
        sum vector of raised sums.

      • logarit

        public static double logarit(double value,
                             double base)
        Making logarithm of the specified value with regard to specified base.
        Parameters:

        base - specified base
        Returns:

                               double base)

        Parameters:

        base - specified base.
        Returns:
        array of values which are logarithms of elements of specified vector with regard to specified base.

        Returns:

      • cartesianProduct

        public static <T> java.util.List<java.util.Set<T>> cartesianProduct(java.util.List<java.util.Set<T>> list)
        Given a specified list of many sets, this method returns a list of Cartesian products from such many sets. For example, given two sets {a, b, c} and {1, 2}, this static method returns six Cartesian products such as {a, 1}, {a, 2}, {b, 1}, {b, 2}, {c, 1}, {c, 2}.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of elements of sets.
        Parameters:
        list - specified list of many sets.
        Returns:
        List of Cartesian products for list of many sets.

        public static final <T> java.util.List<T> pickingRandom(java.util.List<T> container,
                                                        int pickNum)

        Type Parameters:
        T - type of elements.
        Parameters:
        container - specified list from which elements are picked.
        pickNum - the number of random elements picked randomly from specified list (container).
        Returns:
        List of elements picked randomly from specified list (container).

      • pickingOrdering

        public static final <T> java.util.List<T> pickingOrdering(java.util.List<T> container,
                                                          int pickNum)
        Extracting a sub-list of specified list so that the sub-list has pickNum first elements of the specified list.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of elements.
        Parameters:
        container - specified list called container.
        pickNum - the number elements of the returned sub-list.
        Returns:
        sub-list of specified list. Such sub-list has pickNum first elements of the specified list.

      • transpose

        public static final double[][] transpose(double[][] matrix)
        Transposing the specified matrix. Note that a matrix was transposed if its rows becomes its columns and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        matrix - specified matrix.
        Returns:
        transposed matrix.

      • getColumnVector

        public static final double[] getColumnVector(double[][] matrix,
                                             int column)
        Getting column vector of specified double matrix at specified column. In other words, such column vector contains all values of specified matrix at the same column.
        Parameters:
        matrix - double matrix.
        column - specified column.
        Returns:
        column vector of specified matrix at specified column.

      • setColumnVector

        public static final void setColumnVector(double[][] matrix,
                                         int column,
                                         double[] cvector)
        Replacing all values of specified double matrix at the specified column by values of specified vector. The parameter matrix is both input and output parameter.
        Parameters:
        matrix - specified double matrix.
        column - specified column.
        cvector - specified vector.

      • manhattanDistance

        public static final double manhattanDistance(double[] a,
                                             double[] b)
        Calculating the Manhattan distance between two specified double arrays. Manhattan distance is sum of absolute deviations between elements of two arrays.
        Parameters:
        a - the first array.
        b - the second array.
        Returns:
        Manhattan distance between two specified double arrays.

      • findExtremeValue

        public static double[] findExtremeValue(java.util.List<java.lang.Double> list,
                                        boolean isMax)
        Finding extreme value in the specified list.
        Parameters:
        list - specified list.
        isMax - true if finding maximum; otherwise finding minimum.
        Returns:
        a 2-element array whose first element is the extreme value and second element is the first index of such extreme value. Return null if extreme value cannot be found.
